info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 7:59AM EST until January 14 at 8:15AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EST FOR NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 758 AM EST, a hazardous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Brookville to near Ford City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Punxsutawney, Kittanning, Ford City, New Bethlehem, West Kittanning, Rural Valley, Dayton, Summerville, West Hills, Hawthorn, Manorville, Ford Cliff, Applewold, Lenape Heights, Timblin, Worthville, Smicksburg, Crooked Creek Lake Park, Templeton, and Mahoning Creek Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
